titles.en: Chapter 24 – Washing the clothes of the menstruating woman

titles.ar: باب الْمَرْأَةِ يَرْتَفِعُ طَمْثُهَا مِنْ عِلَّةٍ فَتُسْقَى الدَّوَاءَ لِيَعُودَ طَمْثُهَا
titles.en: Chapter 22 – The woman whose menstruation (Haydh) is raised due to illness, so she drinks the medicine in order for her menstruation (Haydh) to return

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/256)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سَهْلِ بْنِ الْيَسَعِ عَنْ أَبِيهِ قَالَ

text: سَأَلْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنِ الْمَرْأَةِ تَخْتَضِبُ وَ هِيَ حَائِضٌ قَالَ لَا بَأْسَ بِهِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Sahl Bin Al Yas’a, from his father who said,
‘I asked Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> about the woman dyeing (her hair) and she is menstruating. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no prolem with it’.
en.sarwar: 1. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Muhammad ibn Sahl ibn al-Yasa’ from his father who has said the following: “I once asked abu al-Hassan, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the case of a woman who uses dye during her Hayd (menses). He (the Imam) said, ’It is not harmful.”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (13/256)

narrator_chain.text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ سَعِيدٍ عَنِ النَّضْرِ بْنِ سُوَيْدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ قَالَ

text: قُلْتُ لِأَبِي إِبْرَاهِيمَ ( عليه السلام ) تَخْتَضِبُ الْمَرْأَةُ وَ هِيَ طَامِثٌ قَالَ نَعَمْ .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Al Husayn Bin Saeed, from Al Nazar Bin Suweyd, from Muhammad Bin Abu Hamza who said,
‘I said to Abu Ibrahim<sup>asws</sup> (7<sup>th</sup> Imam<sup>asws</sup>), ‘Can the woman dye (her hair) and she is menstruating?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Yes’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ahmad ibn Muhammad has narrated from al-Husayn ibn Sa‘id from al-Nadr ibn Suwayd from Muhammad ibn abu Hamzah who has said the following: “I once asked abu Ibrahim, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, if a woman experiencing Hayd (menses) can use dyes. He (the Imam) said, ‘Yes, she can do so.’”
